snippet: Ray Fair has studied the economy’s effect on American elections for decades. His projections show the president with a slight lead, but that might change.
abstract: Jeff Sommer Strategies column contends that whether Pres Obama wins re-election will depend mainly on the economy; cites projections by economist Ray C Fair, who studies economy's effect on American elections who says margin between Obama and an unnamed Republican is slim and too close to make a valid forecast.
lead_paragraph: Ray Fair has studied the economy’s effect on American elections for decades. His projections show the president with a slight lead, but that might change.

headline.print_headline: Through an Economic Lens, An Election Too Close to Call
headline.seo: An Election Too Close to Call, as Seen in an Economic Lens
headline.main: Through an Economic Lens, an Election Too Close to Call
